item.title: Report E-2024090418
item.description:
Report E-2024090418

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: MOUNT VERNON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1204 ET, XPO terminal UMV notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1-Quart of Premier 6 PH-18 HS Urethane Activator medium released due to unknown reasons. The release impacted trailer #3178599. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used oil dri to absorb the spill and a 5-Gallon metal drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091111
item.description:
Report X-2024091111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PUT INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.
